label: At the end of a sprint a Product Backlog item worked on during the sprint does not meet the definition of Done . What two things should happen with the undone Product Backlog item?

choices.label: If the stakeholders agree, the Product Owner can accept it and release it to the users.
Do not include the item in the increment this Sprint.
Review the item, add the"Done" part of the estimate to the velocity and create a Story for the remaining work.
Put it on the Product Backlog for the Product Owner to decide what to do with it.

correctChoises.label: Do not include the item in the increment this Sprint.
Put it on the Product Backlog for the Product Owner to decide what to do with it.

label: Of the following choices, what is the most effective way a Scrum Master can keep a Development Team working at its highest level of productivity?

choices.label: Ensure the meetings start and end at the proper time.
Facilitate Development Team decisions and remove impediments.
Prevent changes to the backlogs once the Sprint begins.
Keep high value features high in the Product Backlog.

correctChoises.label: Facilitate Development Team decisions and remove impediments.

label: Which two ways of creating Development Teams are consistent with Scrum’s values?

choices.label: Bring all the developers together and let them self-organize into Development Teams.
The Chief Product Owner determines the new team structures and assignments.
Managers personally re-assign current subordinates to new teams.
Existing teams propose how they would like to go about organizing into the new structure.
Managers collaborate to assign individuals to specific teams.

correctChoises.label: Bring all the developers together and let them self-organize into Development Teams.
Existing teams propose how they would like to go about organizing into the new structure.

label: For which is the Scrum Master responsible?

choices.label: The Scrum process being adopted and used properly.
Keeping track of resource allocation.
Managing the performance of the Scrum Team.
The meetings and the objectives that a Scrum Team sets for itself.

correctChoises.label: The Scrum process being adopted and used properly.

label: If two Scrum Teams are added to the development of a product that previously had only one Scrum Team, what will be the immediate impact on the productivity of the original Scrum Team?

choices.label: Its productivity is likely to increase.
Its productivity is likely to stay the same.
Its productivity is likely to decrease.

correctChoises.label: Its productivity is likely to decrease.

label: A new developer is having continuing conflicts with existing Development Team members and creating a hostile environment. If necessary, who is responsible for removing the team member.

choices.label: The Development Team is responsible, and may need help from the Scrum Master.
The hiring manager is responsible, because he/she hired the developer.
The Product Owner is responsible, because he/she controls the return on investment (ROI).
The Scrum Master is responsible, because he/she removes impediments.

correctChoises.label: The hiring manager is responsible, because he/she hired the developer.

label: Why is the Daily Scrum held at the same time and same place?

choices.label: Rooms are hard to book and this leis it be booked in advance.
The place can be named.
The Product Owner demands it.
The consistency reduces complexity.

correctChoises.label: The consistency reduces complexity.

label: Who is responsible for managing the progress of work during a Sprint?

choices.label: The most junior member of the Team
The Development Team
The Scrum Master
The Product Owner

correctChoises.label: The Development Team

label: The Product Owner is not collaborating with the Development Team during the Sprint. What are two valuable actions for a Scrum Master to take?

choices.label: Nominate a proxy Product Owner.
Coach the Product Owner in the values of Scrum and incremental delivery.
Stop the Sprint, send the Product Owner to a course and restart.
Inform the Product Owner's functional manager.
Bring up the problem in the Sprint Retrospective.

correctChoises.label: Coach the Product Owner in the values of Scrum and incremental delivery.
Bring up the problem in the Sprint Retrospective.

label: who is responsible for tracking the remaining work of the Sprint?

choices.label: The Product Owner
The Development Team
The Project Manager
The Scrum Master
The Development Team in consultation with the Product Owner

correctChoises.label: The Development Team

label: Which two ways of creating Development Teams are consistent with Scrum’s values?

choices.label: Existing teams propose how they would like to go about organizing into the new structure.
Bring all the developers together and let them self-organize into Development Teams.
Managers collaborate to assign individuals to specific teams.
Managers personally re-assign current subordinates to new teams.
The Chief Product Owner determines the new team structures and assignments.

correctChoises.label: Existing teams propose how they would like to go about organizing into the new structure.
Bring all the developers together and let them self-organize into Development Teams.

label: which three of the following are timeboxed events in Scrum?

choices.label: Release Testing
Release Retrospective
Daily Scrum
Sprint 0
Sprint Testing
Sprint Retrospective
Sprint Planning

correctChoises.label: Daily Scrum
Sprint Retrospective
Sprint Planning

label: Who determines how work is performed during the Sprint?

choices.label: Subject matter experts
The Development Team
Architects
The Scrum Master
Development Team managers

correctChoises.label: The Development Team

label: Why does a Development Team need a Sprint Goal?

choices.label: Sprint Goals are not valuable. Everything is known from the Product Backlog.
The Development Team is more focused with a common yet specific goal.
A Sprint Goal ensures that all of the Product Backlog items selected for the Sprint are implemented.
A Sprint Goal only gives purpose to Sprint 0.

correctChoises.label: The Development Team is more focused with a common yet specific goal.

label: How do you know that a Development Team is cross-functional?

choices.label: There are no conflicts within the Development Team.
Every member of the Development Team is able to perform every task.
A few of the Development Team members pair program and do Test Driven Development.
Development Team has all the skills to create a releasable increment by the end of every Sprint.

correctChoises.label: Development Team has all the skills to create a releasable increment by the end of every Sprint.

label: How do you know that a Development Team is cross-functional?

choices.label: Every member of the Development Team is able to perform every task.
A few of the Development Team members pair program and do Test Driven Development.
Development Team has all the skills to create a releasable increment by the end of every Sprint.
There are no conflicts within the Development Team.

correctChoises.label: Development Team has all the skills to create a releasable increment by the end of every Sprint.

label: When does the next Sprint begin?

choices.label: Next Monday.
When the Product Owner is ready.
Immediately after the conclusion of the previous Sprint.
Immediately following the next Sprint Planning.

correctChoises.label: Immediately after the conclusion of the previous Sprint.

label: When might a Sprint be abnormally terminated?

choices.label: When the Sprint Goal becomes obsolete.
When the Development Team feels that the work is too hard.
When the sales department has an important new opportunity.
When it becomes clear that not everything will be finished by the end of the Sprint.

correctChoises.label: When the Sprint Goal becomes obsolete.

label: The CEO asks the Development Team to add a "very important" item to a Sprint that is in progress. what should the Development Team do?

choices.label: Add the item to the next Sprint.
Inform the Product Owner so he/she can work with the CEO.
Add the item to the current Sprint and drop an item of equal size.
Add the item to the current Sprint without any adjustments.

correctChoises.label: Inform the Product Owner so he/she can work with the CEO.

label: During a Sprint Retrospective, for what is the Product Owner responsible?

choices.label: Summarizing and reporting the discussions to the stakeholders that he/she represents in the Scrum Team.
The Product Owner should not take part in Sprint Retrospectives.
Capturing requirements for the Product Backlog.
Participating as a Scrum Team member.

correctChoises.label: Participating as a Scrum Team member.

label: who can abnormally terminate a Sprint?

choices.label: The Scrum Master
The Product Owner
The Development Team or its members
The Stakeholders i

correctChoises.label: The Product Owner

label: Which three of the following are true about Scrum?

choices.label: Scrum is based on empirical process control theory.
Scrum is a methodology, where you can pick and choose which parts of Scrum you think will work for your environment.
Each component of Scrum serves a specific purpose, and is essential to Scrum's success and your usage of Scrum to develop complex products.
Scrum is a framework for developing and sustaining complex products.
Scrum is like traditional processes but with self-organization to replace Project Managers.

correctChoises.label: Scrum is based on empirical process control theory.
Each component of Scrum serves a specific purpose, and is essential to Scrum's success and your usage of Scrum to develop complex products.
Scrum is a framework for developing and sustaining complex products.

label: Does Scrum have a role called "Project Manager'?

choices.label: Yes
No

correctChoises.label: No

label: You are the Scrum Master an a newly formed Scrum Team. Which three of the following activities would probably help the team in starting up?

choices.label: Ensure the team understands they need a definition of "Done.
Have the development managers for each Development Team member introduce their direct reports and go over their responsibilities on the Scrum Team.
Ask the Product Owner to discuss the product or project, its history, goals, and context, as well as answer questions.
Ensure the Scrum Team members have compatible personalities.
Have the Scrum Team members introduce themselves to each other and give a brief background of their skills and work history.
Introduce a bonus system for the top performers in the team.

correctChoises.label: Ensure the team understands they need a definition of "Done.
Ensure the Scrum Team members have compatible personalities.
Have the Scrum Team members introduce themselves to each other and give a brief background of their skills and work history.

label: What happens if the Development Team cannot complete its work by the end of the Sprint?

choices.label: The Sprint is extended and future Sprints use this new duration.
The Sprint is extended temporarily. Lessons are taken to ensure it doesn't happen again.
The Sprint length holds and the Development Team continuously learns what is actually possible to do within a Sprint of this length.

correctChoises.label: The Sprint length holds and the Development Team continuously learns what is actually possible to do within a Sprint of this length.

label: Every Scrum Team must have a Product Owner and Scrum Master.

choices.label: A Scrum Master is only required when asked for by the Development Team.
Each must be 100% dedicated to the Scrum Team.
Outcomes are affected by their participation and availability.
A Product Owner can be replaced by a business analyst in the Development Team.

correctChoises.label: Outcomes are affected by their participation and availability.

label: Which outcome is expected as Scrum Teams mature?

choices.label: Sprint Reviews will no longer be needed.
The Sprint Retrospectives will grow to be longer than 4 hours.
They will improve their definition of "Done" to include more stringent criteria.
There is no need for a time-boxed Sprint, since time-boxes are only for new Scrum Teams.
A Scrum Master is no longer needed since they are a mature team now.

correctChoises.label: They will improve their definition of "Done" to include more stringent criteria.

label: The time-box for a Daily Scrum is?

choices.label: The same time of day every day.
Two minutes per person.
4 hours
15 minutes.
15 minutes for a 4 week sprint. For shorter Sprints it is usually shorter.

correctChoises.label: 15 minutes.

label: The Daily Scrum is an event that happens every day. What would be three key concerns if the frequency were to be lowered to every two or three days?

choices.label: Too much work is spent updating the Scrum board before the meeting.
The Scrum Master loses the ability to update the Gantt chart properly.
The Sprint plan becomes inaccurate.
Opportunities to inspect and adapt the Sprint Backlog are lost.
The Product Owner cannot accurately report progress to the stakeholders.
Impediments are raised and resolved more slowly.

correctChoises.label: The Sprint plan becomes inaccurate.
Opportunities to inspect and adapt the Sprint Backlog are lost.
Impediments are raised and resolved more slowly.

label: When many Development Teams are working on a single product, what best describes the definition of "Done?

choices.label: Each Development Team uses its own but must make their definition clear to all other Teams so the differences are known.
Each Development Team defines and uses its own. The differences are discussed and reconciled during a hardening Sprint.
All Development Teams must have a definition of "Done" that makes their combined work potentially releasable.
It depends.

correctChoises.label: All Development Teams must have a definition of "Done" that makes their combined work potentially releasable.

label: what is the main reason for the Scrum Master to be at the Daily Scrum?

choices.label: To gather status and progress information to report to management.
To make sure every team member answers the three questions.
He or she does not have to be there; he or she only has to ensure the Development Team has a Daily Scrum.
To write down any changes to the Sprint Backlog, including adding new items, and tracking progress on the burn-down.

correctChoises.label: He or she does not have to be there; he or she only has to ensure the Development Team has a Daily Scrum.
